definition: 秦越人[Qin2 Yue4 ren2] (407-310 BC), Warring States physician known for his medical skills, nicknamed Bian Que after the earliest known Chinese physician allegedly from the 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4] era
flat/(coll.) to beat (sb) up/old variant of 匾[bian3]
small boat
surname Pian
magpie

sentences.english: He sees things, active request to find cures textual.
sentences.chinese: 他看到情況不妙，主動要求找扁鵲來治病。

sentences.english: They had a meeting, textual twist went.
sentences.chinese: 兩人剛一見面，扁鵲扭頭就走。

sentences.english: But, foreseeing this, Bian Que had long gone to Qin and dodged such a request.
sentences.chinese: 可是，扁鵲早就預料到了這一點，跑到秦國躲了起來。

sentences.english: Five days afterwards, the king felt his body aching all over. At once he sent for Bian Que.
sentences.chinese: 五天以後，蔡桓公感到全身疼痛，立刻派人去請扁鵲。

sentences.english: Que temple key units to be protected in order to save.
sentences.chinese: 扁鵲廟爲省重點文物保護單位。

sentences.english: Bianque was a famous physician in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 扁鵲是中國古代著名的內科醫生。

definition: Pang Juan (-342 BC), military leader and political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
Hua Tuo (?-208), famous doctor at the end of Han Dynasty
Sun Bin (-316 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
turmoil/social upheaval
Li Guang (-119 BC), Han dynasty general, nicknamed Flying General 飛將軍|飞将军 and much feared by the Xiongnu 匈奴
side door
to feel the pulse (TCM)/Taiwan pr. [zhen3 mo4]
to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
to observe the ritual mourning
sorcery
Zou Yan (305-240 BC), founder of the School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
surpassing/excelling/preeminent/unique
subtle words with profound meaning (idiom)

(TCM) the four methods of diagnosis, namely 望診|望诊[wang4 zhen3] (observation), 聞診|闻诊[wen2 zhen3] (auscultation and olfaction), 問診|问诊[wen4 zhen3] (interrogation), 切診|切诊[qie4 zhen3] (pulse feeling and palpation)
Lian Po (327-243 BC), famous general of Zhao 趙國|赵国, repeatedly victorious over Qin 秦國|秦国 and Qi 齊國|齐国
talented field commander (military)
